TopicTitle: Issue with file save after editing status of crew member

Articles.Content:
I have killed Jebediah, and wanted to bring him back, so I went to the persistent.sfs of that save and changed his status to "Available". The game now says "string was not recognized as a valid boolean" and I'm worried, that if I load the save I'll make things worse. I am playing on the newest version.

Mods I have installed:

  • KerbalEngineer
  • MechJeb2 (for 1.8)
  • KerbalVR (installed after I got the error)

Here's persistent.sfs: https://gist.github.com/Cynderblood/f67888f70c58f7f5398bbc807e78f60f

Edited September 13, 2020 by Cynderblood
fixed typo

I don't what you did but I have coded in unity before the issue is that you used quotes that in code is a string you need to remove the quotes because a boolean must be one or the other but I need to know where it is to help you more because that file is massive i don't have the time to check of the lines in the file.

Edited September 13, 2020 by NoobWhoLikesSpace
